{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl|num=1|
double      riemann_zeta( double arg );

@1@ Computes the [[enwiki:Riemann_zeta_function|Riemann zeta function]] of {{c|arg}}.
@2@ A set of overloads or a function template accepting an argument of any [[cpp/types/is_integral|integral type]]. Equivalent to {{v|1}} after casting the argument to {{c|double}}.

{{cpp/experimental/special_functions/macro_note|riemann_zeta}}

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|arg|value of a floating-point or integral type}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
If no errors occur, value of the Riemann zeta function of {{c|arg}}, {{math|ζ(arg)}}, defined for the entire real axis:
* For {{math|arg &gt; 1}}, {{math|Σ{{su|b=n{{=}}1|p=∞}}n{{su|p=-arg}}}}.
* For {{math|0 ≤ arg ≤ 1}}, {{math|{{mfrac|1|1 - 2{{su|p=1-arg}}}}Σ{{su|b=n{{=}}1|p=∞}}(-1){{su|p=n-1}}n{{su|p=-arg}}}}.
* For {{math|arg &lt; 0}}, {{math|2{{su|p=arg}}π{{su|p=arg-1}}sin({{mfrac|πarg|2}})Γ(1 − arg)ζ(1 − arg)}}.

===Error handling===
Errors may be reported as specified in [[cpp/numeric/math/math_errhandling|math_errhandling]].
* If the argument is NaN, NaN is returned and domain error is not reported.

===Notes===
Implementations that do not support TR 29124 but support TR 19768, provide this function in the header {{tt|tr1/cmath}} and namespace {{tt|std::tr1}}.

An implementation of this function is also [https://www.boost.org/doc/libs/1_60_0/libs/math/doc/html/math_toolkit/zetas/zeta.html available in boost.math].

===Example===
{{example
|(works as shown with gcc 6.0)
|code=
#define __STDCPP_WANT_MATH_SPEC_FUNCS__ 1
#include &lt;cmath&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;

int main()
{
    // spot checks for well-known values
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "ζ(-1) = " &lt;&lt; std::riemann_zeta(-1) &lt;&lt; '\n'
              &lt;&lt; "ζ(0) = " &lt;&lt; std::riemann_zeta(0) &lt;&lt; '\n'
              &lt;&lt; "ζ(1) = " &lt;&lt; std::riemann_zeta(1) &lt;&lt; '\n'
              &lt;&lt; "ζ(0.5) = " &lt;&lt; std::riemann_zeta(0.5) &lt;&lt; '\n'
              &lt;&lt; "ζ(2) = " &lt;&lt; std::riemann_zeta(2) &lt;&lt; ' '
              &lt;&lt; "(π²/6 = " &lt;&lt; std::pow(std::acos(-1), 2) / 6 &lt;&lt; ")\n";
}
|output=
ζ(-1) = -0.0833333
ζ(0) = -0.5
ζ(1) = inf
ζ(0.5) = -1.46035
ζ(2) = 1.64493 (π²/6 = 1.64493)
}}
